intro: Nassauvia ameghinoi, commonly known as the Chilean flamebrush, is a shrub native to the central and southern regions of Chile. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange.
